title: Volume Push
explanation: Starting your week with a volume push session to build upper body strength and muscle endurance. This workout focuses on progressive overload while maintaining proper form. The 3-round structure allows for adequate volume without excessive fatigue.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Push + Legs block combines upper body pressing with lower body strength. This pairing allows for efficient training while maintaining intensity.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.explanation: Primary horizontal pushing movement for chest, shoulders, and triceps. Start with 60kg to establish baseline strength.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.explanation: Unilateral leg exercise that builds stability and strength. The 20kg dumbbell adds resistance while maintaining balance focus.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block targets posterior chain and core stability. This combination supports posture and overall strength balance.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.explanation: Vertical pulling movement for latissimus dorsi and biceps. Bodyweight focus on quality over quantity.

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raises
exercises.explanation: Core stability exercise targeting lower abs and hip flexors. RPE 7 ensures controlled movement quality.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Power + Conditioning block combines explosive movements with cardio elements. This builds athleticism and work capacity.

exercises.name: Box Jumps
exercises.explanation: Plyometric exercise for power development and coordination. RPE 8 ensures explosive intent on each rep.

exercises.name: Dips
exercises.explanation: Compound pushing movement for triceps and chest. Bodyweight focus on controlled movement and full range of motion.

title: Base Run Z2
explanation: Aerobic base building run in Zone 2 heart rate. This builds cardiovascular endurance and fat oxidation capacity. The 8km distance provides adequate volume without compromising recovery from yesterday's strength session.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Continuous aerobic effort to build base fitness and recovery capacity.

exercises.name: Easy Run
exercises.explanation: Zone 2 running at 140 BPM builds aerobic base and improves fat oxidation. Should feel conversational pace.

title: Volume Pull
explanation: Volume pull session to balance the pushing movements from Monday. This workout targets the posterior chain and pulling muscles, ensuring balanced development and injury prevention.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Legs block focuses on posterior chain development and hip hinge patterns.

exercises.name: Bent-Over Rows
exercises.explanation: Horizontal pulling movement for rhomboids, middle traps, and lats. 50kg provides moderate resistance for volume work.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
exercises.explanation: Hip hinge movement targeting hamstrings and glutes. Lighter weight focuses on movement quality and muscle activation.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block emphasizes upper back strength and core stability.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldowns
exercises.explanation: Vertical pulling movement targeting lats and biceps. 35kg allows for controlled movement and full range of motion.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.explanation: Isometric core exercise for stability and endurance. 45 seconds at RPE 7 builds core strength without compromising form.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Power + Conditioning block combines explosive pulling with cardio elements.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swings
exercises.explanation: Hip hinge power movement for posterior chain development. 16kg kettlebell provides explosive training stimulus.

exercises.name: Battle Ropes
exercises.explanation: High-intensity conditioning exercise for upper body and core. 30 seconds at RPE 8 builds work capacity.

title: HIIT Cardio+Strength
explanation: High-intensity interval training combining cardio and strength elements. This workout improves both aerobic and anaerobic capacity while building muscular endurance. The 30s work/30s rest format maximizes metabolic stress.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Cardio + Strength block combines high-intensity cardio with bodyweight strength movements.

exercises.name: Burpees
exercises.explanation: Full-body high-intensity exercise combining squat, push-up, and jump. 30 seconds at RPE 9 maximizes cardiovascular stress.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.explanation: High-intensity cardio exercise targeting core and legs. 30 seconds at RPE 8 maintains intensity while building endurance.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Strength + Cardio block focuses on muscular endurance with cardio elements.

exercises.name: Push-up to T
exercises.explanation: Dynamic push-up variation with rotational element. 30 seconds at RPE 8 builds upper body strength and stability.

exercises.name: Jump Squats
exercises.explanation: Explosive lower body exercise for power and endurance. 30 seconds at RPE 9 maximizes metabolic demand.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Core + Cardio block targets core stability with high-intensity cardio finish.

exercises.name: Russian Twists
exercises.explanation: Rotational core exercise for obliques and stability. 30 seconds at RPE 7 maintains quality movement under fatigue.

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.explanation: High-intensity cardio exercise for legs and coordination. 30 seconds at RPE 9 provides maximum metabolic challenge.

title: Volume Push
explanation: Second volume push session of the week with slight progression. Building on Monday's workout, this session increases intensity while maintaining volume. The 48-hour rest period allows for adequate recovery.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Push + Legs block with increased intensity from Monday's session.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.explanation: Progressive overload: 2.5kg increase from Monday. This 4% increase maintains strength progression while allowing for proper form.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Monday maintains progressive overload while building unilateral strength and stability.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block with maintained intensity and focus on movement quality.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.explanation: Maintaining bodyweight focus to ensure quality movement and full range of motion. Strength will develop through consistency.

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raises
exercises.explanation: Slight increase in reps from Monday (10→12) provides progressive overload for core strength development.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Power + Conditioning block with maintained intensity and focus on explosive movement quality.

exercises.name: Box Jumps
exercises.explanation: Maintaining RPE 8 ensures explosive intent on each rep while building power and coordination.

exercises.name: Dips
exercises.explanation: Increase in reps from Monday (10→12) provides progressive overload while maintaining movement quality.

title: Interval Run Z4
explanation: High-intensity interval training to improve VO2 max and lactate threshold. The 6×800m intervals at Zone 4 provide optimal stimulus for cardiovascular improvement while building mental toughness.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Warm-up phase to prepare the body for high-intensity work.

exercises.name: Easy Warm-up
exercises.explanation: Easy pace warm-up to increase heart rate and prepare muscles for high-intensity work.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Main interval work at Zone 4 heart rate for VO2 max development.

exercises.name: 800m Interval
exercises.explanation: 800m at Zone 4 (170 BPM) provides optimal stimulus for VO2 max improvement. Should feel hard but sustainable.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Cool-down phase to gradually return heart rate to baseline.

exercises.name: Easy Cool-down
exercises.explanation: Easy pace cool-down to gradually return heart rate to baseline and promote recovery.

title: Volume Pull
explanation: Final volume pull session of the week with slight progression. This workout balances the week's training load while building on Wednesday's session. The 48-hour rest from Friday's push session ensures adequate recovery.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Legs block with increased intensity from Wednesday's session.

exercises.name: Bent-Over Rows
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Wednesday maintains progressive overload while building upper back strength.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Wednesday maintains progressive overload while focusing on movement quality.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block with maintained intensity and focus on movement quality.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldowns
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Wednesday maintains progressive overload while building lat strength.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.explanation: 5-second increase from Wednesday (45→50) provides progressive overload for core endurance.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Power + Conditioning block with maintained intensity and focus on explosive movement quality.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swings
exercises.explanation: 2kg increase from Wednesday maintains progressive overload while building explosive power.

exercises.name: Battle Ropes
exercises.explanation: 5-second increase from Wednesday (30→35) provides progressive overload for work capacity.

title: Volume Push
explanation: Week 2 begins with continued progressive overload on volume push. Building on last week's sessions, this workout increases intensity while maintaining volume. The weekend rest allows for full recovery and adaptation.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Push + Legs block with continued progression from Week 1.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Friday (62.5→65) continues progressive overload. This 4% increase maintains strength progression.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Friday (22.5→25) continues progressive overload while building unilateral strength.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block with maintained intensity and focus on movement quality.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.explanation: Maintaining bodyweight focus to ensure quality movement and full range of motion.

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raises
exercises.explanation: Maintaining reps and RPE from Friday to ensure movement quality and proper progression.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Power + Conditioning block with maintained intensity and focus on explosive movement quality.

exercises.name: Box Jumps
exercises.explanation: Maintaining RPE 8 ensures explosive intent on each rep while building power.

exercises.name: Dips
exercises.explanation: Maintaining reps from Friday to ensure movement quality and proper progression.

title: Base Run Z2
explanation: Progressive aerobic base building run in Zone 2 heart rate. The 10km distance (up from 8km last week) provides increased volume while maintaining aerobic development. This builds on last week's base fitness gains.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Continuous aerobic effort to build base fitness and recovery capacity with increased volume.

exercises.name: Easy Run
exercises.explanation: Zone 2 running at 140 BPM for 10km builds aerobic base and improves fat oxidation. 2km increase from last week provides progressive overload.

title: Volume Pull
explanation: Week 2 volume pull session with continued progression. Building on last week's sessions, this workout increases intensity while maintaining volume. The 48-hour rest from Monday's push session ensures adequate recovery.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Legs block with continued progression from Week 1.

exercises.name: Bent-Over Rows
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Sunday (52.5→55) continues progressive overload while building upper back strength.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Sunday (42.5→45) continues progressive overload while focusing on movement quality.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block with continued progression from Week 1.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldowns
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Sunday (37.5→40) continues progressive overload while building lat strength.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.explanation: 5-second increase from Sunday (50→55) continues progressive overload for core endurance.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Power + Conditioning block with continued progression from Week 1.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swings
exercises.explanation: 2kg increase from Sunday (18→20) continues progressive overload while building explosive power.

exercises.name: Battle Ropes
exercises.explanation: 5-second increase from Sunday (35→40) continues progressive overload for work capacity.

title: HIIT Cardio+Strength
explanation: Week 2 HIIT session with maintained intensity and focus on work capacity. The daytime slot provides variety in training schedule while maintaining the same high-intensity stimulus. This builds on last week's metabolic adaptations.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Cardio + Strength block with maintained intensity from Week 1.

exercises.name: Burpees
exercises.explanation: Maintaining 30 seconds at RPE 9 to ensure maximum cardiovascular stress and metabolic adaptation.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.explanation: Maintaining 30 seconds at RPE 8 to build endurance while maintaining intensity.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Strength + Cardio block with maintained intensity from Week 1.

exercises.name: Push-up to T
exercises.explanation: Maintaining 30 seconds at RPE 8 to build upper body strength and stability.

exercises.name: Jump Squats
exercises.explanation: Maintaining 30 seconds at RPE 9 to maximize metabolic demand and power development.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Core + Cardio block with maintained intensity from Week 1.

exercises.name: Russian Twists
exercises.explanation: Maintaining 30 seconds at RPE 7 to ensure quality movement under fatigue.

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.explanation: Maintaining 30 seconds at RPE 9 to provide maximum metabolic challenge and coordination.

explanation: Week 2 second volume push session with continued progression. Building on Monday's session, this workout increases intensity while maintaining volume. The 48-hour rest from Wednesday's pull session ensures adequate recovery.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Push + Legs block with continued progression from Monday's session.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Monday (65→67.5) continues progressive overload. This 4% increase maintains strength progression.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.explanation: 2.5kg increase from Monday (25→27.5) continues progressive overload while building unilateral strength.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Pull + Core block with maintained intensity and focus on movement quality.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.explanation: Maintaining bodyweight focus to ensure quality movement and full range of motion.

exercises.explanation: Maintaining reps and RPE from Monday to ensure movement quality and proper progression.

title: Interval Run Z5
explanation: High-intensity interval training to improve VO2 max and anaerobic capacity. The 8×400m intervals at Zone 5 provide maximum stimulus for cardiovascular improvement while building mental toughness. This progression from last week's 6×800m Z4 increases intensity.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Warm-up phase to prepare the body for maximum intensity work.

exercises.name: Easy Warm-up
exercises.explanation: Easy pace warm-up to increase heart rate and prepare muscles for maximum intensity work.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Main interval work at Zone 5 heart rate for maximum VO2 max development.

exercises.name: 400m Interval
exercises.explanation: 400m at Zone 5 (180 BPM) provides maximum stimulus for VO2 max improvement. Should feel very hard but sustainable for the duration.

exerciseRounds.explanation: Cool-down phase to gradually return heart rate to baseline.

exercises.name: Easy Cool-down
exercises.explanation: Easy pace cool-down to gradually return heart rate to baseline and promote recovery.
